page.title: 17Yetholm Floods
page.content: Saturday 3rd November 1984. Duncanhaugh Mill was flooded! After continuous heavy rain the River Bowmont rose rapidly flooding low lying fields. At 2.30pm the Haugh was green by 2.45 the river was in the house the gate into the Haugh submerged! The swirling muddy water came into the house by back and front doors and the Baxi fire air vent simultaneously. We hurriedly moved books, electrical items and furnishings upstairs. The flood receded quickly after reaching a depth of 60cms. Everything was covered in silt slime sand and other debris which had to be shovelled out before we could lift the carpets. All the floor coverings were ruined and wallpaper spoilt. The house felt damp and cold for weeks despite being heated day and night.
